questiontext.text:

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

Lets first look at what we are given:

  • Total surface area of cylinder P = {@ SA_P @} cm²
  • Total surface area of cylinder Q = {@ SA_Q @} cm²
  • Length of cylinder P = {@ L_P @} cm
  • Volume of cylinder P = {@ V_P @} cm³
(a) Find the length of cylinder Q
  1. Find the area (surface area) scale factor:
    \( \text{Area scale factor} = \dfrac{S_Q}{S_P} = \dfrac{{@ SA_Q @}}{{@ SA_P @}} = {@ scale_factor_area @} \)

  2. Find the linear (length) scale factor:
    Since area scale factor = (length scale factor)²,
    \( \text{Length scale factor} = \sqrt{{@ scale_factor_area @}} = {@ scale_factor_length @} \)

  3. Find the length of Q:
    \( L_Q = {@ L_P @} \times {@ scale_factor_length @} = {@ L_Q @}\ \text{cm} \)

Answer (a): {@ ta_ans1 @} cm

(b) Find the volume of cylinder Q
  1. Find the volume scale factor:
    \( \text{Volume scale factor} = (\text{length scale factor})^3 = {@ scale_factor_length @}^3 = {@ scale_factor_volume @} \)

  2. Find the volume of Q:
    \( V_Q = {@ V_P @} \times {@ scale_factor_volume @} = {@ V_Q @}\ \text{cm}^3 \)

Answer (b): {@ ta_ans2 @} cm³

Summary:

  • Length of cylinder Q: {@ ta_ans1 @} cm
  • Volume of cylinder Q: {@ ta_ans2 @} cm³
